answers.answer: Eye surgery is rarely done under general anesthesia and there is no reason for you to take the extra risks and expense of general anesthesia.the pupil may dilate with more than the regular amoung of dilating drops, if not there are surgical instruments called pupil dilators that will dilate the pupil and hold it open.JCH III MD
